formulaList.sureToDelete1: You are about to delete the evidence formula '
formulaList.sureToDelete2: '. Are you sure you want to do this? This action can not be undone, please confirm.

infoDialog.title: How to use the Evidence-Formula Editor
infoDialog.introduction: The Evidence-Formula Editor currently supports boolean expressions including number comparisons, variables and function calls. More complex behaviour has to be done in pre-defined functions.
infoDialog.variable: The available variables can be seen on the right. Keep in mind that currently only Boolean and Number type variables can be used directly inside the Evidence-Formula all others are instead used when evaluating functions.
infoDialog.testing: The formulas can be tested by pressing the 'Test' button at the bottom. When testing an Evidence-Formula the variables in the gray box on the right are used.
infoDialog.example: An expression could for example look like this: 'speed > 10 & inArea(WRECKAGE)'.
